0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• do not inject systemically as that can lead to extensive intravascular clotting and death
  • Control of hemorrhage: mild/moderate, apply 100 units/mL TOPICALLY as needed
  • Control of hemorrhage: severe, apply 1000 units/mL TOPICALLY as needed

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy in children have not been established

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Control of hemorrhage
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Procedure on artery - Pseudoaneurysm

2.title: Black Box Warning
2.mono:
Topical (Powder for Suspension; Kit)
The use of topical bovine thrombin preparations has occasionally been associated with abnormalities in hemostasis ranging from asymptomatic alterations in laboratory determinations, such as prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT), to severe bleeding or thrombosis which rarely have been fatal. These effects appear to be related to the formation of antibodies against bovine thrombin and/or factor V which in some cases may cross react with human factor V, potentially resulting in factor V deficiency. The risk of antibody formation increases with repeated use. Patients with antibodies to bovine thrombin preparations should not be re-exposed to these products.

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to thrombin or components of bovine origin
  • direct circulatory injection; extensive intravascular clotting and even death may occur

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: antibody formation against bovine thrombin and/or factor V, may cross react with human factor V; potentially resulting in factor V deficiency and abnormalities in hemostasis, including bleeding or thrombosis

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Thrombin: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Thrombin is a protein substance of bovine origin that immediately clots the fibrinogen of the blood without the aid of a physiological agent.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    for topical use only; do NOT inject, as intravascular clotting and death may result
  • Topical
    • (powder) may be used dry or reconstituted
    • reconstitute with NS to a recommended concentration of 1000 to 2000 units/mL; solution may be diluted with NS to other concentrations as needed
    • (spray kit) do not transfer spray pump to another vial
    • sponge recipient surface free of blood before application; do not wipe
    • spray or flood surface with solution or powder; or use absorbable gelatin sponges saturated with solution and hold in place with a pledget of cotton or small gauze sponge until hemostasis occurs
    • do not sponge treated surface to assure clot remains in place
    • use solutions promptly or store refrigerated for up to 3 h
